intro: Tarchonanthus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian tarchonanthus, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Tarchonanthus abyssinicus is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
